website_summaries.verdict: This plug works well with HomeKit, but it takes up too much space and isn't a good pick for Android users or Alexa fans.
pros: The Koogeek Smart Plug P1 gives HomeKit users another option for connecting devices
cons: It's so big it blocks outlets below it, and the integration with Alexa didn't work

customer_reviews.title: Works great with HomeKit, no "phone home" network traffic
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't familiar with Koogeek when I was a review for this device, but I am glad that I tried it out. It has never dropped from my wireless network, and was a breeze to set up. Unlike the Smart Outlet from Incipio, this one does not appear to send any regular communication/telemetry to on outside server, which is always a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Oculus

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality product
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality item. Easy to setup and works fine with my Echo. I only wish if the size can be a little bit smaller so I can use the other power outlet after the Koogeek plug-in.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W.

customer_reviews.title: Very buggy, but once it starts functioning, it's great!
customer_reviews.text: Well, it worked the first time I paired to my phone (Apple Homekit), and literally five minutes later, it stopped working. I tried resetting it more than ten times, but it's no use. This device just fails to connect properly. You got to give it an hour or so before you try reconnecting it again. Also, don't even bother trying to connect it to Amazon Alexa because the Amazon skill it comes with doesn't even work. For a device that's meant to be convenient, it's surely inconvenient to get it to work properly. So, as of right now, this is more meant for Apple devices until the Alexa support comes.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Loses WiFi connectivity frequently - unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I mean, it works, but spend the, like, $10 extra to buy literally any other brand that makes the same product. These Koogeek’s frequently just go unresponsive and there’s no way to get them to connect back to WiFi or to Homekit except for powering them down and rebooting. Except, oh wait, the manufacturer didn’t provide any ability to REBOOT the device. Customer service won’t even admit that this is silly, and recommended I just re-power it by unplugging it and plugging it back in. Oh cool, let me just get behind my furniture and power something off by unplugging instead of using the “smart” switch. Not smart. This happens about once or twice a month.
customer_reviews.author: Will Keim

customer_reviews.title: Now it works...and now it doesn't. Registration required to use app
customer_reviews.text: The plugs work and don't work. When they don't, they need to be reset, router need to be set back to 2.4Ghz transmission only, the home kit setup sometimes works in second, most of the time needs to repeated multiple times before eventually working. In other words, far from seamless, unless other home kit devices I have (e.g. ecobee) that do work as they are supposed to. Finally, in order to use the app you have to register (e-mail), give location info, give access to all home kit accessories. The only reason to install the app in a Home Kit context is to be able to update the firmware, which seems to be otherwise impossible to update.
customer_reviews.author: Mauro

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay connected
customer_reviews.text: It does not stay connected to the network - constant reset and reconnect is a pain. It works for a few days and then it loses connection while everything else is still connected. So I know it’s an issue with the plug, not WiFi. The plug is large (expected for a smart plug) so it blocks other plugs - be aware of this.
customer_reviews.author: EmptiKloud

customer_reviews.title: This is not the Smart Plug you are looking for...
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get it to register to either Apple Home Kit or the Koogeek app. Tried everything in the Koogeek webpage for troubleshooting. No joy. Sent and email to Koogeek support requesting assistance and never heard back.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Best plug for apples Home kit!
customer_reviews.text: The koogeek plug is the best working plug HomeKit the I have seen I tried a few before this and they ended up being to difficult to use beause if you shut off the item there were hooked to you would have to reset the plug. With the koogeek some many things were made easy. I voice control it through home kit and hooking it up took less then a minute and I haven't had to doing anything to since. I now have multiple switches, plugs, and soon lights all from koogeek. there staff and web page are very helpful I recommend them for any apple user if your having a hard time finding what's the best.
customer_reviews.author: Aksurfer1080

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work/horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work, I can switch on and off the device and watch the indicator light go red to green. But the device itself does not get any power. I've tried several devices, several outlets, and tried resetting from factory setting several times. I even tried to reach koogeek about this but all they have is a email and no phone number. They take forever to respond back to you and when they realize it doesn't work they just blow you off. VERY unsatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Crills

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be rebooted every 10 ten days
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a very smart plug. It needs to be rebooted (unplugged then plugged in again) every 7 to 10 days. Sometimes you need to remove then add again to home kit. I am 100% unsatisfied. Also, it hides the second outlet on a a twin wall plug... Very not smart. I've tried numerous time to get support on their web site and no luck there. Going to through in the trash and find another plug. Amazon is no help so probably going to buy next smart plug from Costco which always takes a return item.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Liberty

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!  And a tip that should be in directions...
customer_reviews.text: Previously gave this a lower rating, upping it here. When if your router resets, don't mess with the app or reset buttons on the plugs or anything like that. Wait till the router is back up - and just unplug and replug each unit quickly. They'll go from 'No reponse' to back to normal in about 20 seconds. I was trying every knows solution with the app, every variation of clicking/holding button the unit - but it's simpler than that. Helpful tip if your router resets when your internet goes down and up - happens here every few days.
customer_reviews.author: MARK MOFFITT

customer_reviews.title: Hardware good, software terrible - loses connection, requires hard power cycle
customer_reviews.text: This is a fatal flaw. Automation that requires manual intervention? FAIL. I tried to use one of these to monitor power usage of a computer I don't want to ever shut off. Goes for months at a time where it doesn't work at all because it lost connection, and I'm unwilling to power it off. Had these for more than a year, they still haven't fixed to software! Also the energy monitoring is clunky and buggy. Updates slowly, no way to zero or download the data. Again, software issues. Otherwise the hardware seems to work fine, which is quite unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware! Very Inconsistent!
customer_reviews.text: So frustrated with these... I bought 2. I have a few things setup with my HomeKit such as my door lock by August and my thermostat by Ecobee plus the lights and fan using this product. My lights and fan consistently give me trouble and stop responding causing me to have to unplug them and wait then plug them back in. That seems to help but I shouldn’t have to do that. I know that it’s not my connection because I’ve never had a problem with the other devices, only the Koogeek outlets! Buyer Beware!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Threw it away
customer_reviews.text: Revised review... have owned for about 1/2 year or more. Had some major issues with past iOS updates and my router loosing connection with this from time to time, but just recently I tried again after a new iOS update and it was pretty smooth. I’m hoping it stays connected a higher level or reliability. Not sure if this is mostly on apple or koogeek, but it’s frustrating. I don’t have these issues with my Philip’s lights. I hope this is the last time I need to set it up. Pretty happy that this time it didn’t require using their useless app. You can add it to HomeKit with no extra BS.
customer_reviews.author: C. K.

customer_reviews.title: the Smart Plug seems to disappear and become unresponsive
customer_reviews.text: The setup process for HomeKit is a bit involved, but that's not really the product's fault. This was the first time I set up a HomeKit device, so I had some issues with needed to turn on 2-factor authentication, enabling my Apple TV devices, etc. Throughout this process, the Smart Plug seems to disappear and become unresponsive, but I suspect that was all just part of the activation process as everything works great now. I was disappoint in the lack of being able to dim the connected light, but again, that seems to be a limitation of this kind of device.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G. Picciano

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to automate lights
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and control. There is no hub required, which is both good and bad. Bad because without a hub, these can't be controlled when I am away from home. The phone or tablet w the app must be on the same wifi network to be able to control the plugs. Also, the plugs do not work on 5G system. But, seamless w Siri and simple o set up. You'll need a hub to operate them from a distance. Apple TV or an iPad or iPod that is always at home will do, if it runs iOS 10. I b Cannot speak to Android setup or operation.
customer_reviews.author: SannyTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Used to be a contender
customer_reviews.text: Wha happen!? These were great a couple of years ago. They were one of the more affordable options for Apple HomeKit back then and they set up nice and easy. Then a couple months ago they just took a dump. Support is non-existent. I had to swap them out with some new eves that have been awesome so far. Two plugs and one socket no longer connect. Infuriating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great products.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great neat home kit product. It took me quite a while to set up because some Obvious information was missing but I'd still be giving it 5 stars. A few points to save you from that frustration. 1. It only works on 2.5ghz Wifi band network. 2. You have to manually go into your wifi settings and add it as an accessory. Else you'd end up with an error prompt. Otherwise, it works as expected. I also love the energy consumption feature.
customer_reviews.author: Lem

customer_reviews.title: I have a lot of these, but...
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of these plugs, both old and new. If you can get them cheap, they work alright. Most disappointing is the disconnection from WiFi every few months. After disconnecting, the units must be unplugged and replugged in to reconnect and work with Homekit again. There is no rhyme or reason to which once go out when... On a positive note - the timers/schedules still function, even when disconnected, so the lights usually maintain their program cycles - they're just unavailable to operate or monitor remotely. I've stopped purchasing this brand and moved on to other smarter products.
customer_reviews.author: M. K.

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: It worked for 8 hours, then shut down, indicating that it was out of range (in a location where everything else is connected to the internet). Moved it to a different room - it accepts the code, but does not show up as a device to be added - which precludes resetting. Apparently no other solution available. Advice is “keep trying”, which does not produce a different result. I do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Verne E. Blodgett

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box and set up was great.
customer_reviews.text: So far this is one of the easiest smart plugs that I set up, also the first that i got that works with home kit and i like that once I set up the plug in the Koogeek app it was automatically in my home kit app, cant wait to start controlling it with Siri and setting up Sean’s and what not! Hopefully it will last one and stay connected, but out of the box 5 stars, I will post an update after a few weeks of use!
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: HomeKit plugs for Christmas tree!
customer_reviews.text: I’m using two of these for my Christmas trees and I love them! So glad to not have to plug and unplug the trees every day! I set them up in my Home app and they have worked flawlessly. They are on an automated schedule with several other HomeKit devices. After Christmas, I’ll move them and use them somewhere else. These were a great price! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Ellis

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Homekit plug. I had to return the first one (from another company, not Koogeek) because it kept losing its connection on a daily basis. I've had this one for over a week and it's never lost its connection (the other company's plug would have lost connection 6-7 times by now). So I like this one. I should also mention that I've used Koogeek for another product (a Homekit powerbar) and also had a near perfect experience.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo

customer_reviews.title: Works okay when it works.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't really impressed with this plug. It works with Apple HomeKit, but it doesn't stay connected to wi-fi very well. It was often unreliable and we'd have to get up and push the button (or just unplug whatever was plugged into it) to turn it off. And to re-connect it, you have to basically reset and re-pair it with your phone, which is a pain. We picked up a TP-Link plug for the same price and it works SO much better.
customer_reviews.author: Kyrie Tompkins-Overlock

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a poorly designed item or at least the App is. Very unclear how to set on and off times. I would not recommend buying this. There are better outlet controls, like the Smartlife mini smart plug. It also appears broken after a week of use. Causes the light to stutter and blink. scaring the dogs. DON'T BUY!!!!! And this is one of the more expensive smart outlets. Makes it an even worse deal.
customer_reviews.author: Carlton S. Yee

customer_reviews.title: App is horrible and broke after less 7 months.
customer_reviews.text: The app is terrible, very hard to program and schedule and it says my wife has no permissions to change schedules even though I set her up with permissions. Had to use Apple Homekit instead which is better but after koogeek's latest update, they're completely bricked. In both Koogeek app and Homelit app it says updating and then says no response on both our Koogeek's so it must be the update because they broke the same day. Tried resetting etc, nothing worked. Totally unusable now. Our wemo unit was more dependable app wise and hardware wise.
customer_reviews.author: ChiliPep123

customer_reviews.title: The product is fine with a big caveat - connection is very shaky
customer_reviews.text: The product is fine with a big caveat - connection is very shaky. Sometimes i have to unplug it every few weeks, sometimes multiple times a day! Hard to recommend it... Edit: downgrading my rating as it does not work more often than it does. Ability to control it using homekit is practically gone. I tried resetting and it works for the first hour. Then it’s back to “no response”...
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy this product. Buy the Wemo Mini Smart Plug instead.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if the problem is with the app or the device but as other reviewers noted this is unstable when trying to use with iPhone. I could get it to connect but after a few seconds it would lose it's connection. This happened in both the native koogeek app (which appears to be just a copy of Apple's Home App) and in the Apple Home app. Ultimately I gave up and returned this smart, but dumb, plug and purchased the Wemo Mini Smart Plug. I highly recommend the Wemo product. It was easy to connect and it works well with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: CBcansurvive

customer_reviews.title: smart plug for...your xmas tree
customer_reviews.text: the initial set up was great, it literally took less then 3 minutes for me. it did what i needed it to do, which was set up a timer schedule for my christmas tree. everything was working great, but then there would be times where the app wouldn't recognize the smart plug. i'm sure the distance to the router may have had an issue with it. my router was placed far but not too far that there was no signal, but as always it helps if the product is close to the router. other then that, i enjoyed this product. looking forward to using it again next year.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M. Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Great landscape lighting timer replacement
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I am using this with HomeKit to turn my low voltage landscape lighting on/off on a schedule, plus I can turn it on/off at will as well. I had a small issue with wifi, as the lighting transformer box is a solid stainless steel box, essentially a faraday cage (not at all the fault of the plug). But I made a simple passive repeater with 2 antennas that allows signal in to the box and it's all working awesome!
customer_reviews.author: R. Klems

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and too big
customer_reviews.text: Most unreliable plugs. I bought the six pack to use with HomeKit but the plugs go unresponsive 90% of time when I need them to work. It is frustrating and they demonstrated their failed ability to my friends so my friends are definitely not going to buy this brand. Apple should start time-test evaluation for such devices that uses their technology and grade it. Additionally, the plugs are too big that they cover the second wall plug so you are left with no spare Wall socket. See the pictures. I discourage this brand for anyone who is looking to buy smart plugs. I am hoping to return the unused plugs but not sure I can now.
customer_reviews.author: Manish M

customer_reviews.title: Now it works...and now it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: Unreliable network connectivity. Needs to be completely re-set up every couple of months. Turn off the 5Ghz network, leaving only the 2.4Ghz, reboot the router, pair with the HomeKit-enabled phone, try to pair again, reset the plug a couple of times, pair again, try to pair till it works, add to home kit, reprogram any automations you may have had, done. Repeat every couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Mauro

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects Most of the Time
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today. Managed to get it running, but then it disconnected shortly thereafter. It has been disconnected more than it has been connected so far. Useless and frustrating. I’m returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Enchanted Tiki Room

customer_reviews.title: I use iOS (Siri) to communicate with all my smart gadgets. These plugs work with Koogeek house (free ...
customer_reviews.text: I use iOS (Siri) to communicate with all my smart gadgets. These plugs work with Koogeek house (free download). I plugged a $10 coffee maker into one of these plugs. After creating a scene for Siri to understand (easy to do), I now wake up in the morning and tell her to turn on the coffee. I don't have to worry about whether the machine is off either becaue the app will tell me. Easy to use, install and great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Spicer

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: Great product for when ur just being lazy or wanna make your house/apt feel more modern. Or have timers or such on devices. Can also help with tracking energy consumption. Had a lil connection issue with my first one, but cx care took care of me fast and sent me a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Magaña

customer_reviews.title: Meh 😑. Update 5/7 🙂
customer_reviews.text: Update5/7/17: Customer service was excellent. They responded and understood the problem. Clear communication helped in resolving the issue. Although I may have gotten a defected item, I will look for Koogeek products in the future. Stopped working after 3.5 months of use. Tried resetting and reconnecting but it just would not connect. This accessorie has the slowest response time out of my other homekit accesories. I dont even bother using the button on my apple watch as it never works while to turn whatever i have connected to. Its not my phone, watch, or wifi as my other homekit accesories work instantly.
customer_reviews.author: scurtis

customer_reviews.title: Timer is off
customer_reviews.text: The device is worthless. The timer does not work. Homekit status will be "Updating" or "No Response". I started replacing them with iHome switches that work everything. If I could, I work return them to the seller. Worst electronic purchase ever. I wasted the money This device (the second one I ordered) does not work well. I programmed the device and it starts 10 minutes later (off by 10 minutes). Terrible! I will ask for an exchange/replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Ernst A.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer remorse.......
customer_reviews.text: When I 1st discovered this HomeKit Plug I was over the moon excited to get them and I read some the reviews and saw that some people did mention the disconnection issues but I though ehh it was a user issue or or a small percentage but was I wrong I have to unplug and power cycle these plugs DAILY and it has reached the point where you couldn’t give me another one of these thing. Yes I made sure they were wishing a reasonable area for WiFi (hell they have there own 2g ssid Yes I updated the firmware Yes I rest it to factory and reconfigure them NO none of that has worked!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Damon

customer_reviews.title: Some good, some bad
customer_reviews.text: This smart plug has some good qualities....and some bad ones. I’ll start with the good -functional -looks nice It does have some negatives though -automation does not work. or at least I couldn’t get it to work. it would just flip the light I had it hooked up to on and off repeatedly. -app is clunky and hard to use. For turning on or off a lamp or a tv with your phone, this plug excels. For anything other than that, it does not.
customer_reviews.author: BrettS

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with dual-frequency routers
customer_reviews.text: Not very “smart” at all if I have to completely disable the 5ghz to use it. The “smart” setup didn’t work either, had to do it manually every time. Finally did work on 2.5ghz with 5ghz disabled. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: does job but not the best
customer_reviews.text: Does the job although I have had unit stop responding to network. native app is okay but use home kit on phone as less fuss. During network dropouts {per unit itself loosing its settings randomly} I have had to use much older 5s not current 7 iPhone to re-pair to network and function!!!! as for size its bulky and in my opinion a issue for most uses {would rather output be on side or bottom!!! }
customer_reviews.author: alecgator

customer_reviews.title: Home Automation
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on the lamp in my living room. It took a little bit to get it hooked up, but has been working well since I got it set up the way I wanted! It works with Apple Home Kit and with my Amazon Alexa. I’ve got it programmed to turn on in the afternoon and turn off after we go to bed.
customer_reviews.author: Krisitne

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with new wifi router
customer_reviews.text: This plug worked fine for about 1.5 years. Then it would no longer work with Siri, but still worked via the Home app. Then after upgrading my wifi router to a dual band system, it no longer worked at all (or only worked sporadically after restarting). Evidently it doesn't work with dual band routers, so now it's worthless. It seems like it's now outdated - would not recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: will only work for a few months
customer_reviews.text: This is a review after i used the product for 6 months. It work intermittently after about 6 months. It's annoying to have siri says she cannot find the device and I would have to unplug and plug it back in for it to work for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Hien Doan

customer_reviews.title: Planned obsolescence! Do not buy this plug!
customer_reviews.text: The button is very poorly soldered to the circuit board with no reinforcement. Every time you press the physical switch it flexes this soldered joint. It only takes a short amount of presses to break the switch. You may not notice if you never use the physical switch but once this happens you’ll never be able to reset the plug to a new WiFi network. I was able to reflow the solder but most people will not have the ability to do this. Plus it is glued shut so this required a hack saw to open. See attached photo
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy E Betts

customer_reviews.title: Works but poor design
customer_reviews.text: I really like that this HomeKit-compatible smart plug allows me to monitor power consumption—something my Belkin Wemo smart plugs don’t offer. However, I don’t think it was engineered or perhaps built as well as the Wemo plugs because it makes a soft but noticeable pulsating screeching sound when in use. Should I be worried about it? Hopefully not but it bothers me nonetheless. As others have mentioned, it blocks the adjacent outlet because of its bulk.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: This smart switch is functionally perfect from a performance and consistent ...
customer_reviews.text: This smart switch is functionally perfect from a performance and consistent on/off operation point of view. The only two hiccups are the size of the device, which covers the other outlet on a wall, and the app energy monitoring, which is not very intuitive. The iDevices switch is the gold standard in this product category, but this Koogeek model is usually half the cost and works just as well. This unit should be your first HomeKit device if you are thinking about getting into the HomeKit ecosystem.
customer_reviews.author: richie

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: A nice addition to my home automation system. Cost effective & works okay with Apple HomeKit. Have some issues with them dropping offline occasionally but simply unplugging them for a few moments fixes the issues. Used them with my exterior landscape lights & for many Christmas decorations.
customer_reviews.author: ccs93Top Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and very reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and very reliable. Quick response to On & Off commands both locally, and remotely if you have AppleTV. Nice power monitoring via OEM app. I wish the timers in the OEM app would allow on off times set by sunrise or sunset plus or minus a certain number of minutes. So for example, the ability to turn on the outlet at sunrise -20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Easiest setup ever!
customer_reviews.text: Completely reversing my previous 0 review to a 5 star — the easiest setup ever if you make sure your iPhone/ipad is on the same 2.4gh net router, plug SMART-PLUG into socket, open up the MY HOME, hit the + sign & name/add new outlet ... boom-done! Hey Siri, turn on living room ... Sparkly Stars! [my first failed experience was following Koogeek instructions rather than just using Apple’s MY HOME setup]
customer_reviews.author: e

customer_reviews.title: Convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to control my two lamps. Before, I would have to go around the room and turn on both lamps if I wanted my office to be nice and bright, but when I plugged both into a power strip and plugged that into the smart plug, I could turn on both with a Siri command! Its a small convenience, but its the little things that make all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Peng

customer_reviews.title: HomeKit to control window A/C unit, Good budget HomeKit plug!
customer_reviews.text: I got it on a Kinja deal. Couldn't pass up for price. I use this in conjunction with the Elgato Eve Room sensor to control my window A/C unit via HomeKit on my Apple devices. Easy set up like all HomeKit stuff (except the Lyric T5, that thing was a MONSTER to set up with HomeKit). I wish their software were more robust though (compared to idevices software which calculates energy use and actual cost over time, VERY nicely done there btw). But, for basic HK outlet use, works great!
customer_reviews.author: EttanASF

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pair and use
customer_reviews.text: Update: I got a replacement promptly, great customer service! It works very well and is easy to pair. I turn it on and off with Siri and have a schedule to turn it off automatically at a certain time My first one broke quickly, but they contacted me and sent me a replacement promptly
customer_reviews.author: A. Aragon

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a few months. No reply from customer support.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two and they worked well enough for a few months. Not totally reliable, but not bad. After a few months they don't pair at all. No response from customer report after multiple attempts to contact them. I had another that arrived dead which I returned via Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Matt C

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one since the goal is to use Homekit as much as possible. The product was easy to install and works great. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Pelle

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well with HomeKit.
customer_reviews.text: I have never gotten this to work in HomeKit, and although it has updated it would not update even when using the app. Its now being used as a dust collector. Will not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dmase

customer_reviews.title: When it fails, avoid contacting customer service and expect no fix
customer_reviews.text: When it fails, avoid contacting customer service because they seem not to read your email and definitely are very unhelpful. In fact, I had to throw the smart-plug away because, after months of waiting for them to fix the bugs in the app for iOS, there is still no solution. Check the ratings in the App Store, they have less than 2 and counting.
customer_reviews.author: Josué Caramés

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects from Internet and Becomes Unreachable By Phone
customer_reviews.text: This product is really buggy. On the website it says it has the ability to set a timer, the app says otherwise. It's great when it works, but it disconnects almost every other month and it's a PAIN to reconnect. I have an iPhone 6s and Xfinity wifi. I live in a small city apartment so wifi connection shouldn't be an issue. My friend had this product and he says it works fine for him. On the box it says you have to connect to the weaker (2.4gh instead of 5gh) internet setting, which is absurd. I would not recommend this product to a friend
customer_reviews.author: Angel Velasco

customer_reviews.title: A bit finicky at times, but overall really cool.
customer_reviews.text: I have occasional issues with connectivity, where the unit will just stop responding and the app shows 'updating'. I've had to delete the device and reconnected a few times, though things appear stable now. Aside from that, very cool little device.
customer_reviews.author: Scott_B

customer_reviews.title: The initial set up to your network is super simple. That's were the simplicity of setting up ...
customer_reviews.text: The initial set up to your network is super simple. That's where the simplicity of setting up this product ends. Instruction manual tells you how to connect to your network, and that's it. Programming on/off sequences, "scenes" etc is all a guessing game. The app UI (user interface), is horrible which is frustrating enough for me to return this product. I would give this product 4 stars if they figure out how to make setting up programs etc easier to figure out, or provide instructions in the manual. Using this product will leave adjacent outlet useless. If manufacturer figure out how to make this a touch smaller, and easier to set up, this could be a 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: GRogers

customer_reviews.title: Very glitchy. Either the technology is not available yet ...
customer_reviews.text: Very glitchy. Either the technology is not available yet or this manufacturer just put out a piece of junk. First of all, I just couldn't get more than one Iphone or Ipad to control the outlet. After a few hours of use the connection between the phone and the outlet would be lost. I ended up returning it. I will try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: I don't usually write review, but this thing just ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write review, but this thing just doesn't work. It constantly is disconnected and needs to be reconnected. I have tried to contact koogeek and they basically told me that's how its supposed to work.
customer_reviews.author: macaras

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money !
customer_reviews.text: Works for 5 minutes and then it went down. You restart it and again works for a few minutes. Bad software. Don’t buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple setup, works right away, easy to navigate.
customer_reviews.text: Love being able to control lights or...else from an automation. This plug gives me total control through my Android Smartphone and is Simple setup with Google assistant. Plug it in, enter the code, give it a name and you're good to go. Their app also is very easy to navigate. The only improvement I'd like to see is a smaller form factor so it can be plugged in without blocking the other outlet.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Connecting with Alexa is a pain. There is no ...
customer_reviews.text: Connecting with Alexa is a pain. There is no clear instructions. It was connected after wasting hours and after 2 days it got disconnected on its own and now it connects but won’t response with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: tarik habib binoy

customer_reviews.title: Had this for one week so far I am happy with it it monitors the voltage consumption of devices ...
customer_reviews.text: Had this for one week so far I am happy with it it monitors the voltage consumption of devices that are plugged into it you could set schedule for the outlet to turn on and off and has an app where you can do all this in. Also able to control with Siri and compatible with Apple HomeKit.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: We just built a new home and wanted to make sure we integrated HomeKit compatible devices. Mostly all the devices we purchased have been awesome, but not this one. This device never works with HomeKit or their app. I'm constantly having to re-sync it to the app. Even their native app doesn't recognize it. The sad thing is that I bought two of these and neither work. I do not recommend buying this item.
customer_reviews.author: atlee

customer_reviews.title: Definitely would recommend for everyone!
customer_reviews.text: The Koogeek Smart Plug was an amazing purchase. It allows you to control whatever is plugged into it from anywhere in your home at anytime. The free app is very user-friendly and easy to set up. The only downside is that you have to be connected to the wifi to use it so it cannot be used on the go. The upside to this problem is the schedules system!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product since May 2017, so 5 months, and so far so good. During that time period I think I had to reconfigure it just one time, and that may have been caused by something I did wrong as this is my first IOT device. I bought this because it’s compatible with Apple HomeKit and the price was the best I found for and IOT outlet. One slight criticism is that it’s bulk gets in the way of using the second outlet on a standard duplex plug. Also, the instructions could have been more comprehensive to include setup in the Apple HomeKit app. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Worked with Apple Homekit with no problems
customer_reviews.text: I had zero problems setting this up with Apple Homekit, you just manually enter the device code and you're good to go. Also, this outlet handles 1800W which is good enough to use with most small space heaters (which was my intended application), so no worries about overloading it.
customer_reviews.author: typo_kign

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use; form factor may be a problem.
customer_reviews.text: As my first HomeKit purchase to begin the journey in home automation that I am impressed by the Koogeek Smart Plug. It was easy to setup and the App works well and is well thought out. Seems to have all the features one would need for device and scene control. I have found it to be very reliable and am looking to purchase others. The biggest drawback is that it partially blocks the other outlet on a duplex outlet. So I will likely buy a short extension cord to alleviate this.
customer_reviews.author: Eric K.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, although I had trouble using the koogeek app ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, although I had trouble using the koogeek app and it only worked for me by connecting directly with HomeKit (available on Apple iOS devices only). This thing is large and, if you're plugging it into a standard US double socket you'll have trouble using that socket for anything else. However, I can turn my Christmas tree lights on and off without trying to fit behind the sofa to get to the outlet, so it's a win!
customer_reviews.author: FJT

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, only works with HomeKit OR Alexa, not both.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping that I could use this product with both Alexa and Apple HomeKit. I was disappointed that it was one or the other. However, the setup and maintaining the product is easy to do and I recommend this to anyone with one of the home automation choices.
customer_reviews.author: Danny M. Uff

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: After following the instructions to a "T" (including doing the master reset before using the plugs), everything has worked perfectly out of the box. The app works beautifully, and pairing the plugs to my WiFi was seamless and invisible to me, the end user. The Home application sees the plugs and enables the automations and timers. Everything works great!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Works for the most part.
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, while connected to a fan under my pc it looses signal and I can’t control it with the HomeKit app. But when it’s connected to my Christmas tree it’s fine. Weird.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I’m somewhat new to home automation and have been using ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m somewhat new to home automation and have been using Apple HomeKit. These plugs worked perfectly right out of the box. I plugged them in and paired them right away, and now my Christmas tree can be controlled by Siri! I will be buying Koogeek wall switches next!
customer_reviews.author: ScottM2007

customer_reviews.title: I like it so much I just bought my third one.
customer_reviews.text: I like it so much I just bought my third one. The Koogeek Smart Plug for Apple HomeKit responds quickly and is reliable. There aren't many HomeKit devices in the market yet, but this one has recently been priced as low as $24 with a coupon on Amazon. At that price it's the best deal for something that just works.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Pricey and has more features than necessary.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, has its own cloud and ios app. States that it has a power monitor feature which I've not investigated because it doesn't make sense that a device like this do more than on/off. I might buy more but the price is an impediment​.
customer_reviews.author: James Scott Jr.

customer_reviews.title: HomeKit smart plug
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to hook up and hasn’t lost the WiFi signal, struggled with other brands staying hooked to WiFi. Have hooked to HomeKit
customer_reviews.author: Steven long

customer_reviews.title: Awesome awesome. My only gripe is that it covers ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome awesome. My only gripe is that it covers up the outlet above or below it..if they could slim this down just a bit, that would be a huge improvement. But functionality wise, this is on point. The Automation is key as well as the ease of use. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tomp

customer_reviews.title: Device does not stay connected to WiFi
customer_reviews.text: This device will not stay connected to the WiFi in my apartment. The plug will stay connected for about 15 minutes after setting the device up for HomeKit control. After that, I receive an error stating that the device is unavailable. The only way to fix this has been to unplug the device from the wall, then plug it back in. I have a 4th generation Apple TV acting as a HomeKit hub in my apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Walsh

customer_reviews.title: worked fine until it broke August 2017
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in March, 2017, worked fine until it broke August 2017. So not great on reliability. I actually use this thing and rely on it to work. Koogeek's customer service is slow to respond and a hassle compared to other companies I've dealt with. I recommend going with a different brand,
customer_reviews.author: Jax5

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: It looks great, easy to install. I love it. But options are limited and the charger to connect to an outlet is not included. Bummer! Otherwise nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: Beware: Off Site Remote Access Only If ---->
customer_reviews.text: NO REMOTE ACCESS AWAY FROM HOME/LOCATION UNLESS YOU HAVE APPLE TV OR AN APPLE TABLET. They have to be at the location and connected to your wifi. So, if you do have an Apple tablet, you have to leave it home to use this remotely... or you have to buy an Apple TB if you don't have one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Fox

customer_reviews.title: An automatic plug that you need to manually unplug once a week so it will work... definition of irony?
customer_reviews.text: It works fine for a while... and then loses network connectivity and is basically dead in the water. The only way to get it to work again is to manually unplug it and plug it in again. Ironic?
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Very Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 5 of these outlets and they have all been working perfectly since installing them a month ago. Easy to use interface with Apple Home Kit. Very reliable with no wifi disconnect issues, which was a major problem with WEMO WiFi Outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: This is so tiny outlet compared to other smart outlet. I am an apple user and i ...
customer_reviews.text: This is so tiny outlet compared to other smart outlet. I am an apple user and i was looking for a apple homekit compatible smart outlet and i found this. This is so usesful for my room. I have connected my heater on this outlet so now i can control it with my voice. I like how its built not to bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Hisila Karki

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbage. Stopped working after 3 weeks. I have factory reset it, reconnected it to the manufacturer specified 2.4Ghz wireless router and it still will not respond. Not worth the money at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: but the Koogeek is the best..
customer_reviews.text: I have had Kasa, WeMo and others, but the Koogeek is the best....unless you need Alexa . Works with Apple Home Kit which was why I switched to this unit. Only complaint is the design which covers both outlets. The free app is very good as well and integrates with all the rest of my Home Kit Caséta products.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyH

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE:Linking Issue W/ Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Beware: this does NOT work with Alexa. There is a pairing/linking issue with Koogeek and Alexa. Do NOT buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Pergolski

customer_reviews.title: Great Device and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: The Koogeek Smart Plug was easy to set up. Even though it has an app, I use the Apple Home app to control it. Right now I'm using it to control the Christmas tree lights, but plan on using it to control a lamp that is hard to get to in order to turn it on. I recommend this Smart Plug for it's ease of use and the fact that it works well with Apple's Home App.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Heath

customer_reviews.title: I really like them
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy these HomeKit switches. HOWEVER, in a duplex receptacle, you can't plug anything else in because it partially covers the other plug. Never had an issue with connectivity. The Koogeek app is really great too for creating automations! They give you way more options than HomeKit.
customer_reviews.author: Caelan

customer_reviews.title: Using with Apple HomeKit; Not Consistent!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a few days; then NO RESPONSE; reset; works for another few days; the NO RESPONSE
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: This is the cheapest smartplug that works with both Apple ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the cheapest smartplug that works with both Apple HomeKit and Alexa. It works for me! Definitely worth it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: KevinH

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: Set up easily in both Koogeek app and apple home kit the koogeek app is very basic and could use some dressing up. Encounted some issues with response to HomeKit but it is functional . Needs to work with Alexa down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well and setup was easy using the barcode... make sure you are on 2.4ghz when trying to set it up though.
customer_reviews.author: S Shap

customer_reviews.title: Works great, too wide for nearby plugs.
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for just under a month. So far so good. Connected to Homekit easily. Only problem is the size. It is so big that it covers up the other plugs next to it. I have to buy some sort of three-pronged extension. But other than that, I haven't had any issues. I have a three-plug extension plugged into it leading to an led strip and two led spot lights.
customer_reviews.author: wpds

customer_reviews.title: Great outlet
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my desk light. I tell HomeKit to turn on my desk light and it just happens. so cool
customer_reviews.author: KPR

customer_reviews.title: Blocks adjacent outlet.
customer_reviews.text: All of the fancy, technical aspects of this product work flawlessly, but the dimwit enclosure design (it blocks the adjacent outlet on pretty much any receptacle) makes me want to look elsewhere. What were they thinking?
customer_reviews.author: Mac Coder

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Easy setup, looks good with not too big of a footprint. A must have for all HomeKit homes
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel L

product_meta.title: Homekit Smart Plug, Koogeek WiFi Plug Smart Outlet Compatible with Alexa, Apple HomeKit and Google Assistant, No Hub Required, Remote Control only 2.4Ghz Network UL&ETL&FCC Certified (1 Pack)
feature_bullets: 🎁【Control from Anywhere】Turn on/off the electrical devices easily to manage your home on your smart phone or tablet no matter where you are, with koogeek wifi plug and downloading the Koogeek Home APP. Ideal for someone who can not move around very well and needs easy access to turn on/off a device.

🎁【Free Your Hands with Voice】Works flawlessly with Apple Homekit,Alexa, Google Assistant & IFTTT, just say “turn on the smart plug” , your devices can be powered easily. You can turn off your nightstand light after sleeping or when your hands are full, or in a middle of a task, or even when you do not want to move around.

🎁【Cut Electrical Bills】Save your bills via effectively managing your most power consuming appliances with energy monitor function. Koogeek wifi outlet can track power usage for connected devices and costs on Koogeek Life APP from anywhere.

🎁【Customized Schedules】Preset schedules to automatically turn on and off any home Electronics such as lights, fans or coffee machine with koogeek smart socket. With timer function, you can also prevent from overcharging and overheating to keep your electricity safe, and reduce energy use.

🎁【For iOS Devices Only&Blcak Friday Special Gift】 Schedule ON/OFF to Automate Your Home; Control Devices Simultaneously; Monitor Power Consumption; Automate HomeKit-enabled Accessories.Koogeek smart plugs are thoughtful gift for your loved one's for every special occasions Like Halloween, Thanksgiving Day, Cyber Monday, Black Friday, Christmas, and New Year Eve.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
